title: Hunger Is Raging Another War In 'Pre-Famine' Yemen Reducing Its Children To 'Skin & Bones'
text:
As this year marks the fourth year since the beginning of Saudi coalition’s war on Yemen, much of the country’s resources have been destroyed. From economy to infrastructure, the state of things in the country seems devastating.

Millions of people have died in the bombing campaign and driving a lot to the edge of starvation. The condition is now worsening in the country where people are trying to even make ends meet. Four years of conflict have now pushed Yemen, he poorest of Arab states, to the brink of famine. War has cut transport routes for aid, fuel and food, reduced imports and caused severe inflation.

Reuters

The income of all the household’s has also suffered because public sector wages are not being paid and conflict has forced people from their homes and jobs. From women to little children in the remote villages of Yemen where proper healthcare facilities are a big concern, hunger is making it all the worse.

According to the United Nations, 80% of the population is in a dire need of humanitarian assistance and two-thirds of all districts in the country are in a “pre-famine” state.

Parents of younger ones are trying to get their malnourished children treated and the images are heartbreaking.

"Before the war, we managed to get food because prices were acceptable and there was work ... Now they have increased significantly.”
